pageContext.claim: “We built a very powerful wall. It was a wall that is virtually impossible to get through. It's very, very tough.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump used to say no one could cut through the border barrier he is erecting, or even climb over it: He called it “virtually impenetrable” and likened the structure to a “Rolls-Royce” that border crossers cannot get over, under or through. But then The Washington Post reported that the barrier was easily breached. "Smuggling gangs in Mexico have repeatedly sawed through new sections of President Trump’s border wall in recent months by using commercially available power tools, opening gaps large enough for people and drug loads to pass through," the newspaper reported. The Post also reported a series of large floodgates “must be left open for months every summer during ‘monsoon season’ in the desert.”
